sentences.en: " I can't read your spidery scrawl!
As to writing, we do not encourage them to scrawl too early.
sentences.cn: 至于书法, 我们不鼓励他们过早地乱写.

sentences.en: Don't scribble [ scrawl ] on the wall.
He scrawled his name at the bottom.
sentences.cn: 他在底端潦草地写下了自己的名字。

sentences.en: His signature was an illegible scrawl.
sentences.cn: 他的签名潦草难以辨认.

sentences.en: His signature was an incomprehensible scrawl.
sentences.cn: 他的签字是令人看不懂的涂鸦.

sentences.en: I could hardly read her childish scrawl.
sentences.cn: 我简直认不出她那歪七扭八的字.

sentences.en: I sighed in astonishment - the utter desolation depicted in that rude scrawl was overpowering.
sentences.cn: 我吃惊地叹息着 -- 这匆匆书写下来的无限愁怆之中有一股慑人心魂的力量.

sentences.en: Inside the box was a letter written in scrawl.
sentences.cn: 里面有一封信,字迹很不工整.

sentences.en: Now Tom began to scrawl something on the slate, hiding the words from the girl.
sentences.cn: 这时候,汤姆又在写字板上写着什么字,还用手挡住不让那姑娘看见.

sentences.en: The letter was handwritten, in a hasty, barely decipherable scrawl.
sentences.cn: 这封信是仓促手写而成，潦草得几乎无法辨认。

sentences.en: This letter must be from Frank; I recognized his scrawl.
sentences.cn: 这封信一定是弗兰克写来的, 我认得他那潦草的笔迹.

sentences.en: Your beautiful handwriting puts my scrawl to shame.
sentences.cn: 你那漂亮的书法使我潦草蹩脚的字迹相形见绌.

sentences.en: Your beautiful handwriting puts my untidy scrawl to shame.
sentences.cn: 你漂亮的字体把我的潦草字迹比得见不得人.

trans.tran_cn: 潦草的笔迹，潦草写成的东西

trans.tran_en: to write in a careless and untidy way, so that your words are not easy to read
